snippet: The survey found that Mitt Romney would handily win the New York State primary, though President Obama could still expect to easily capture the state in the November general election.
abstract: The survey found that Mitt Romney would handily win the New York State primary, though President Obama could still expect to easily capture the state in the November general election.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich are neck and neck among Republican voters in New York State, though President Obama holds a commanding lead over either possible challenger, according to a new poll released on Monday.

headline.main: Republicans Trail Obama in New York, Poll Shows
